commit.message:
Call hid_init() at import time, to avoid macOS crash (#150)

fixes https://github.com/trezor/cython-hidapi/issues/142
fixes https://github.com/trezor/cython-hidapi/issues/148

note https://github.com/trezor/cython-hidapi/issues/148#issuecomment-1542302679 :
> HIDAPI on macOS has an additional issue regarding thread-safety.
> I did encountered it in my project(s) but didn't have enough time to gather info/find a root cause.
> Looks like on macOS hid_init/hid_exit needs to be called in the same thread,
> which is an additional restriction compared to other platforms.

verification.payload:
tree 5ae48df7bc9d5893ce8258e03a0a1c2cf3976d1f
parent 8e92053d0d7f5a5dd9bdfeb6a78191ef717cdccf
author ghost43 <somber.night@protonmail.com> 1683789071 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1683789071 +0200

Call hid_init() at import time, to avoid macOS crash (#150)

fixes https://github.com/trezor/cython-hidapi/issues/142
fixes https://github.com/trezor/cython-hidapi/issues/148

note https://github.com/trezor/cython-hidapi/issues/148#issuecomment-1542302679 :
> HIDAPI on macOS has an additional issue regarding thread-safety.
> I did encountered it in my project(s) but didn't have enough time to gather info/find a root cause.
> Looks like on macOS hid_init/hid_exit needs to be called in the same thread,
> which is an additional restriction compared to other platforms.

commit.message:
Update cibuildwheel action to 2.11.2

This should enable the building of wheels for Python 3.11.

expose hid_version_str

`hid_version_str` was added to the underlying C library in 0.10.0,
in https://github.com/libusb/hidapi/pull/192

Note that the method added here returns the version of the C library,
which is different from the version of cython-hidapi, i.e. the `hid` python package.
It would be good to also make the latter available at runtime somehow.

expose version of bindings as `hid.__version__`

I believe it is good practice to expose the version of python
libraries at runtime in the top-level `__version__` attribute.
Depending on how the package was installed, it might be possible
to grab the version setup.py used during installation, using
importlib, but this is not always the case.

```
>>> import hid
>>> ver1 = hid.__version__
>>>
>>> from importlib.metadata import version
>>> try:
...     ver2 = version("hidapi")
... except ImportError:
...     ver2 = None
...
>>> print(f"{ver1!r}, {ver2!r}")
'0.12.0.post2', '0.12.0.post2'
```
bump version to 0.12.0.post2

verification.payload:
tree beec2bde07f0d8431e78ba17fbda3fd987f95dc3
parent 1c8f376da35ae1bc421b2f616c1d5fb8bb12760a
author Pavol Rusnak <pavol@rusnak.io> 1654539946 +0200
committer Pavol Rusnak <pavol@rusnak.io> 1654539946 +0200

bump version to 0.12.0.post2
